creator: dfisher@jmlafferty.com
text:
Error messages like the following say that POI does not support OOXML.

org.apache.poi.poifs.filesystem.OfficeXmlFileException: The supplied data
appears to be in the Office 2007+ XML. POI only supports OLE2 Office
documents

Now that we have support for OOXML the error message generated ought to provide some more help in getting to the proper support in POI. Ideally we would determine which OOXML and point the user to our current support. Maybe the best thing would be to point to a URL on the site for a guide.

The error message in POIFS for poi 3.5 is different and more helpful

The issue is that poi 3.2 (which the error quoted comes from) didn't support ooxml. I guess we could do a new poi 3.2.1 release with a new error message telling you to upgrade, if there's any demand?
creator: apache@gagravarr.org

text:
If we plan to keep 3.2 around after 3.5-FINAL then we definitely need a 3.2.1 to clean up some of the minor license issues in the scratchpad.

I've changed this to 3.2-FINAL issue.
creator: dfisher@jmlafferty.com
apache@gagravarr.org
text: I think we can close this, as 3.2.1 never happened, and 3.5 had the correct message
